name: Legate Rikke
location: Castle Dour, Solitude / Imperial command posts
role: Legate and General Tullius's Chief Tactical Officer

current_status.notes: Conceded the perimeter clash; withdrew to preserve her command function. Left behind dispatch case under duress.

aspects.high_concept: Imperial Legate Torn Between Empire and Skyrim
other_aspects: Tactical Brilliance Hides a Heavy Heart

stunts: Master Strategist: +2 to Tactics when planning military operations. Can create tactical advantages that last multiple exchanges.
Nord Blood: Despite serving the Empire, Rikke respects Nord traditions. +2 to Empathy when dealing with Nords who understand her conflict.
Inspiring Commander: Once per scene, remove one consequence from an ally through a rousing speech or tactical adjustment.
Great War Survivor: Because of extensive combat experience, +2 to Will against fear or intimidation, and can reroll one failed Fight check per session.
Hidden Faith: Can invoke secret Talos worship to connect with traditional Nords, but risks Thalmor discovery.

consequences.severe: Bitten Hand â€” Sanies Lupinus Exposure (Beast-Blood Seeded)

equipment.special: Battle maps, imperial orders, hidden Talos amulet

personality_notes.speaking_style: Professional, tactical, but with hints of Nord warmth. Uses military efficiency but shows compassion. Quotes Talos occasionally (subtle references only).
motivations: End the civil war to protect Skyrim from the Thalmor
Serve the Empire while honoring her Nord heritage
Keep Skyrim strong through Imperial unity
Secretly preserve Nord traditions within the Legion
fears: The Thalmor discovering her secret Talos worship
Skyrim being destroyed by the civil war
Having to kill fellow Nords like Galmar
The Empire betraying Skyrim completely to the Thalmor
quirks: Touches hidden Talos amulet when stressed
Shows respect to worthy Stormcloak opponents

relationships.General Tullius: Loyal subordinate, but wishes he understood Skyrim better
relationships.Galmar Stone-Fist: Former brother-in-arms, now bitter enemy - the relationship pains her
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Respects as a warrior but sees him as misguided and dangerous
relationships.Thalmor: Despises them but must work alongside them
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Hopes he stays loyal to the Empire
relationships.The Player: Sees as potential to end the war, respects capable warriors

setback_triggers: Reveal her Talos worship to Thalmor (-5)

trust_benefits.3: Rikke sees you as a reliable soldier
trust_benefits.5: Rikke shares her tactical wisdom and gives you important missions
trust_benefits.6: Rikke reveals her inner conflict and secret Talos faith
trust_benefits.8: Rikke considers you a true comrade and trusts you completely

combat_tactics: Rikke fights with tactical precision, using terrain and squad positioning. Commands from the front but makes smart use of cover and advantage. More cerebral than Galmar but equally deadly. Will try to minimize casualties on both sides when possible. Uses hit-and-run tactics against superior forces.
dialogue_examples: Ulfric Stormcloak is a hero to some. To others, a villain. But he's a man who will do what he believes is right. Even if it destroys us all.
Talos guide you. (quietly, when Tullius isn't around)
I'm a Nord. Born and bred. But I serve the Empire because I know it's the only thing keeping the Thalmor from completely controlling us.
Galmar... he was like a brother to me once. Now look at us.
We're all Nords here. This war is tearing apart families, friendships. I pray for the day it ends.

secret_talos_worship.discovery_risk: If Thalmor discover her faith, she faces arrest or execution
secret_talos_worship.revelation_scene: At high trust (6+), Rikke may reveal her Talos amulet to party
secret_talos_worship.impact: Shows the complexity of the civil war - even Imperial officers resent the Thalmor
secret_talos_worship.story_hook: Can be used to demonstrate that not all Imperials are Thalmor puppets

questline_role.civil_war_imperial: Primary quest giver and field commander

branching_interactions.if_stormcloak: Becomes enemy but shows reluctance to fight a worthy Nord warrior
branching_interactions.if_imperial: Becomes mentor and tactical advisor, shows her true Nord heart
branching_interactions.if_neutral: Tries to recruit with appeals to protecting Skyrim from Thalmor
branching_interactions.if_renowned_warrior: Sees capable warriors as potential to end the conflict

story_hooks: Rikke worships Talos in secret - a massive risk in her position
She and Galmar fought together in the Great War - now enemies
Conflicted about the Thalmor presence in the Legion
Genuinely wants what's best for Skyrim, not just the Empire
May refuse orders that would unnecessarily harm Skyrim or its people
Could be a bridge between Imperial and Stormcloak if the war ends

inner_conflict.empire_vs_skyrim: Believes Empire is best for Skyrim but hates how it's achieved
inner_conflict.duty_vs_faith: Must hide Talos worship to serve effectively
inner_conflict.former_friends: Faces friends from the Great War as enemies now
inner_conflict.thalmor_presence: Despises working alongside Thalmor but must for the mission

gm_notes: Legate Rikke is the moral complexity of the Imperial side. She's a Nord who genuinely loves Skyrim but believes unity with the Empire is the only way to eventually defeat the Thalmor. Her secret Talos worship should be a powerful reveal that demonstrates not all Imperials are Thalmor sympathizers. She and Galmar represent the tragedy of the civil war - former comrades now enemies. Use her to show that good people can be on opposite sides of a conflict.

loot_if_defeated.special: Talos amulet (hidden) - reveals her secret faith
loot_if_defeated.campaign_impact: Defeating Rikke severely damages Imperial tactical capability and Nord-Imperial relations

alternatives_to_combat.negotiation: Possible if peace benefits Skyrim - she'll listen to reason
alternatives_to_combat.appeal_to_nord_heritage: Effective - she's conflicted about fighting fellow Nords
alternatives_to_combat.reveal_thalmor_schemes: She already knows and hates them - may create common ground
alternatives_to_combat.peace_conference: Would support Season Unending or similar peace efforts

season_unending_role.participation: Key Imperial representative at peace council
season_unending_role.attitude: Genuinely wants peace if it protects Skyrim
season_unending_role.flexibility: More flexible than Tullius, understands Nord concerns
season_unending_role.secret_hope: Civil war ends so Empire can focus on Thalmor threat
